thread.title: The alt-right’s DeploraBall was met with massive protests.
thread.title_full: The alt-right’s DeploraBall was met with massive protests.

author: Osita Nwanevu
title: The alt-right’s DeploraBall was met with massive protests.
text:
— Alexander Rubinstein (@AlexR_DC) January 20, 2017 Scene outside the deploraball pic.twitter.com/iC6WKcPRF8 — Gideon Resnick (@GideonResnick) January 20, 2017 A look at the #DisruptJ20 crowd protesting the #DeploraBall pic.twitter.com/kTcDuouEH9 — Alexander Rubinstein (@AlexR_DC) January 20, 2017 
“We’re going to let these folks know that they are going this far but no farther,” Daryle Lamont Jenkins of the One People’s Project said in a speech. “Y’all stay out here and make sure that they see you! And make sure that they see you well beyond today!” Advertisement 
“We do not want to see or partake in Trump’s policies of exclusion,” said protester Lacy MacAuley. “We say no to what we believe may become the Trump era.” 
Some onlookers, many of them Trump supporters in town for the inauguration and passing by the scene, jeered and engaged with the protesters. “These are ultra-lefties who are behaving radically,” said Ram Lubranicki. “Yelling, threatening, covering their faces. These are cowards.” 
Slate ’s Aymann Ismail took these photos from the scene: A fire set by protesters burns in front of the National Press Building. Aymann Ismail A protester offers police a handful of faux flowers. Aymann Ismail Trump supporters watch protesters from a nearby bar. Aymann Ismail Protester Daryle Lamont Jenkins speaks in front of the National Press Building. Aymann Ismail Lauren Southern, a host with right-wing outlet Rebel Media, reports from the scene. Aymann Ismail 
Osita Nwanevu is a Slate editorial assistant. Load Comments
